newsitem.title: USA: Kentucky outlines revenue collection overhaul.
newsitem.headline: Kentucky outlines revenue collection overhaul.

text.p: Kentucky Gov. Paul Patton proposed a list of Revenue Cabninet reforms aimed at increasing efficiency and improving collections, the Herald Leader said Thursday.
The proposals would cost $178.5 milion to implement, but would generate $148 million a year in savings and new revenue when fully operational in 2004, the newspaper said.
They include installing a new computer system, simplifying filing procedures, and making it easier to catch people and businesses who don't fully pay their taxes.

A state budget steering committee headed by Rep. Harry Moberly, D-Richmond, approved the proposals Wednesday even though the cost exceeds the $103 million that Patton had previously on legislative approval to spend.
